thread.title: Browns' Johnny Manziel admits to drinking after being pulled over
thread.title_full: Browns' Johnny Manziel admits to drinking after being pulled over

author: azcentral.com
title: Browns' Johnny Manziel admits to drinking after being pulled over
text:
Cleveland Browns quarterback Johnny Manziel was pulled over on Interstate 90 in Avon, Ohio, Monday after an argument with his girlfriend. He admitted to drinking earlier that day, according to a report obtained from the Avon Police department.
According to the report, Colleen Elizabeth Crowley, Manziel's girlfriend, said he also pushed her head into the window of his white Nissan. However she did not want to press charges. A witness said Manziel was driving at a high speed and that Crowley was attempting to exit the vehicle before they stopped.
"We were aware of the situation," Browns general manager Ray Farmer said in a statement. "It is a matter that we take seriously and have expressed our concerns to Johnny directly. Those conversations will remain private and we will refrain from further comment at this time."
USA TODAY
Johnny Manziel's mentor: Browns QB will make 'heckuva recovery' after rehab
Cleveland's WEWS-TV , an ABC affiliate, first broke the story.
Manziel took to Twitter to Friday to offer his side.
Colleen and I got into a dumb public argument on the way home Monday afternoon. It probably looked more interesting than it was and...
— Johnny Manziel (@JManziel2) October 16, 2015 I know I would stop and check if I saw a couple arguing on the side of the road. It was embarrassing but not serious...
— Johnny Manziel (@JManziel2) October 16, 2015 and when we talked to the police and they realized everything was alright and I was sober, we went home together and everything is fine.
— Johnny Manziel (@JManziel2) October 16, 2015 Manziel, a former Heisman Trophy winner at Texas A&M and first-round draft pick who is in his second season with the Browns, spent the early part of this year in rehabilitation.
His disastrous rookie season was marred by poor play and high-profile partying. By most accounts, he's been a model teammate this year and won his only start last month in place of injured Browns starter Josh McCown.
Neither Manziel nor Crowley were charged by authorities, who believed neither was intoxicated.
FOR THE WIN
Johnny Manziel, girlfriend release statements after police encounter
They left the scene together.
Crowley posted the following statement on Instagram:
Before things get blown out of proportion.
A photo posted by Colleen Crowley (@coll_crowley) on Oct 16, 2015 at 3:15pm PDT
